column2: I can't believe we've never done this before! It's sooo good! So\ngood for Monica! "
Oh! Look at that, time's up! My turn!"
That was a half an hour?'
It's your timer."
Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the best\nmassages!"
All right, then massage me up right nice!'
Ah! Ahh!! Ahh!!'
It's so good, isn't it?"
It's so good I don't know what I've done to deserve it!"
Say good-bye to sore muscles!'
Good-bye muscles!!'
I'm telling you, she gives the worst massages ever!! Okay, it was like\nshe was torturing me for information. And I wanted to give it up I just\xc2\x97I didn't know\nwhat it was!"
Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.'
Look, for the first time in my life I'm in a real relationship. Okay,\nI'm not gonna screw that up by y'know, telling the truth."
(walking up with Rachel and carrying coffee) Hey.'
Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from\nthe floor. It's one of those magician stovepipe hats.)"
Sorry.'
(examining the hat) And the bunny got away. (Turns and starts looking\nfor the bunny as Joey puts the hat on.)'
(glaring at Joey) This would be the place where you explain the hat.'

Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of
this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that
everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion
stuff."
And you're gonna make them all disappear."
Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.'
Done.'
Joey, if you wanna look good, why don't you just come down to the store?\nI'll help you out."
Great! Thanks, Rach!'
Sure! (Pause) God, please take those off!'
All right. '
Hey Pheebs, how's it going?"
Hey.'
Hey! Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the\nhospital.'
What?'
Is everything okay?'
Are you all right?'
Oh yeah, no-no-no. I'm fine. I'm okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died."
Pheebs! Sorry!'
It's okay, I mean she had a really incredible life. And it's not like\nI'm never gonna see her again, y'know she's gonna visit."
Well maybe, maybe she's with us right now?"
Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she's gonna come to the\ncoffeehouse!"
(entering, in a hurry) Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having sex in a\ncar right outside.'
Uhh, Pheebs' Grandmother just died."
Ohh my God, I'm so sorry."
It's okay. Actually y'know what, it's kinda cool. 'Cause it's like\ny'know, one life ends and another begins."
(to the guys) Not the way they're doing it. What, what happened? How did\nshe die?"
Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some\nyogurt and she just never came back up again.'
Pheebs, I'm so sorry."

It was really sweet. The last thing she said to me was; "Okay dear,\nyou go get the eggs and I\'m gonna get the yogurt and we\'ll meet at the checkout\ncounter." And y\'know what? We will meet at the checkout counter.'
Okay now Joey, y'know that since you're returning all of this stuff\nright after the audition you're gonna have to wear underwear?"
All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then."
Okay, it's missing something. Ooh, I know! Umm, okay. (Goes and grabs a\nbag, that looks like a purse, and shows it to Joey.)"
Really? A purse?'
It's not a purse! It's a shoulder bag."
It looks like a women's purse."
No Joey, look. Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring\ncatalog. Look. (Shows him.) See look, men, carrying the bag.'
See look, women, carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and\nlooks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women's purse\nlooks good on me, a man."
Exactly! Unisex!'
Maybe you need sex. I had sex a couple days ago.'
No! No Joey! U-N-I-sex.'
Well, I ain't gonna say no to that."
It's Phoebe."
Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in?'
Umm, well, umm Grandma died.'
No, she just died today! Okay, umm, we're having a memorial service\ntomorrow."
No you didn't!"
Well, lots of people! Look, are you coming to memorial service or not?'
Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert. (Starts to leave.)'
Hey!'
Hey!'
Wow! You look just like your son Mrs. Tribbiani!'

What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just\nlooked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your\nstuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!"
Your make-up!'
(entering) Joey, what are you doing with the bag? You're audition is not\nuntil tomorrow."
Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts\neating.)'
Joey, y'know you get any mustard on that bag, you can't return it."
Why would I return it? I love this bag!'
All right, then you owe me $350.'
Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He's holding the fake credit cards\nthat come with the bag.)"
(glaring at him) Joey\xc2\x85'
All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am\ndefinitely gonna get thanks to you."
What's the part, Anti-man?"
Hey, don't listen to them. I think it's sexy."
U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.) '
Well hello, Mrs. Penella! Thank you so much for coming! Well, okay look,\nhere's your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on."
Hi sweetie!'
Hey, how are you holding up?'
Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry."
(notices his bag.) Hey, y'know what? My Grandma had the exact same bag!"
Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)'
Thanks!'
Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine.'
Yeah, welcome.'
Umm here's your 3-D glasses."
So how did you know Francis?'
Really?! What's your name?"
(Seeing the look on her face) Y'know what? Strike that. My name uh,\nactually is-is Joe. Uh, Joe umm, Hill."
You're Frank Buffay?"
Shh! (Whispers) No! Joe Hill!'
You just said\xc2\x85'
Y'know what, I gotta go. And thank you so much for coming.\n(Hands back his glasses and hurries out.)"
But\xc2\x85'
Oh my God!'
What?! What honey?'
What happened?'
That was my dad!'
Oh my God!'

(approaches, wearing his glasses) Hey you guys, check it out. Check it
out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It's like it's coming right at me.
(Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey's arm, which causes his hand to slap
him in his face.)"
Oh, did you catch him?!'
Uh-huh.'
Wh-what did he say?!'
He said, "Nice to meet you Glenda." (They stare at her,\ndumbfounded) Well, obviously I couldn\'t give him my real name?'
Why?! Why not?!'
Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here! What do you think? He's\ngonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned!"
What did you say to him?'
Well, I said, I told him y'know, that I was the executor person of\nFrancis' will and that I needed to talk to him so I'm gonna meet him at the coffee house\nlater."
All right, well, I just can't think about that right now. I just wanna\nsay good-bye to my Grandma."
Okay.'
All right, let's go say good-bye."
(entering, with bag) Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?"
Ahhh, I think you look great! That bag is gonna get you that\npart.'
And a date with a man!'

Y'know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And
it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't
make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact
that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)"
All right, I'd better go too. I have to go talk to my dad."
Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say? Are you gonna tell him who you are?'
Umm, no, not at first 'cause I-I don't want to freak him out"

Well, but aren't you pissed at him?! I mean this guy abandoned you!
I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger!
(Getting worked up) I mean I-I-I'd walk in there and I'd be like, "Yo, dad! You and
me outside right now!" (Calming down.) I kinda scared myself.'
Well, at least you scared someone.'
Y'know it's funny, you'd think I'd be angry. I mean, you'd think\nI'd wanna rip his tiny little head off. Fortunately, I'm past it."
Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you. '
All right.'
Oh! Get off!! Ow!! Oh, stop it!! Why?! Why are you doing that to me?!'
What are you talking about?'
As a masseuse and a human, I'm begging you, never do that to anyone!"
(indignant) I give good massages! (Ross laughs.) I used to give them to\nRachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch! (She\nstarts giving Chandler a massage.)'
(seeing the look on Chandler's face) He-he does not like it! He hates\nit! He's in pain!"
No he's not!"
(wincing) Yes, he is!'
What?!'
I'm sorry but, ow-owww-owww!"
You've been lying to me? I can't believe you'd do that."
Well, maybe he just didn't want to hurt your feelings."
But the minute we start to lie to each other\xc2\x85 (Pauses after she\nrealizes what she's saying.) And by 'we' I mean society."
Any time you're ready, Joey."
(reading from the script) Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a\ntable and I'll buy you a drink."
(stopping him) I'm sorry. Could you, could you try it\nwithout the purse?"
Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new\nhere. Maybe we should\xc2\x97I'm sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a\nquestion.)"
Sure. What?'
Well, first it's not a purse."
Okay, anytime.'
I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's\nbag!"
Okayyyy! Anddd, go!'
All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It's the\nlatest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!"
Umm, do you sell these bags?'
Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.'
Okay! Thank you! That was great!'
Yeah but I didn\xc2\x92t read anything.'
I think we've seen enough!"
Okay! All right, I'll see ya. (As he's walking off stage.) (Patting the\nbag.) We got it! We got it!"
Hey, is Rachel here?'
No.'
(coming all the way in) Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this\nafternoon and the whole massage thing. Y'know? I-I really like 'em."
Oh, please, stop! Look, we\'re supposed to be honest with each other. I-I\njust wish you could tell me\xc2\x97just say, "I don\'t like your massages."'
(falling into that trap) I don't like your massages."
(starting to cry) See? It's no big deal."
Okay, but now see you're crying!"
I'm not crying about that! I'm crying about something that happened at\nwork."
What?'
(bursting into tears) My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages."
It's okay, you don't have to be the best at everything."
Oh my God! You don't know me at all!"
Okay, you give the worst massages in the world.'
I'm crying here!!"
Okay, hear me out. Okay? You give the best bad massages. If\nanybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves,\n"Who\'s the best of that?" They\'d have to go to you.'
Huh. So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad\nmassage, well who would get that?"
Oh, it would be you! You! Monica! And you'd get all the votes!"
So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?'
Absolutely!'
Okay. I suck!'
Yeah! (They hug.)'
Umm, thank you for meeting with me.'
Thank you. All right.'

Come, sit. (He's hesitant.) Sit. (Still hesitating.) Sit! (He sits on\nthe arm of the couch.) Umm, all righty, before we get started I just\xc2\x97I need you to\nstate for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay."
Oh yes. Yes, yes, I am, uh-hmm.'
Okay.'
So, what did Francis leave me?'
Huh?'
Well, that's why you wanted me to come, right?"
Oh yes. Yes. Yeah\xc2\x97no. She did. She left you umm, (looking in her\npurse) this lipstick.'
Oh. Huh. It's huh, well it's (opens it) oh it's\xc2\x97ew used. Umm,\ncool."

Okay. I have just a few questions to ask so I'm going to get out my\nofficial forms. (She picks up a couple of crumpled receipts.) Okay, so, question 1) You\nand uh, you were married to Francis' daughter Lilly, is that correct?"
Yes, yes I was.'
Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A. Happily, B. Medium,\nor C. In the total abandonment of her and her two children?'
It really says that?!'
Yeah. See? (Quickly shows him.)'
Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C.'
Hmm, okay, total abandonment. Okay, reasons for abandonment, A.\nTop secret government work, B. Amnesia, or C. Or you're just a selfish, irresponsible bad,\nbad man?"
Y'know, I don't think I want the lipstick that much. (Gets up to\nleave.) But umm\xc2\x85 Oh, would you do me a favor? And umm, would you, would you give\nLilly that, please? (Hands her a note.)"
What?!'

Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note?
Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me
the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out. So, uh, I wrote her that note,
would you give it to her please?'
But you-you-you came to see Lilly?'
Yeah, yeah. Why?'
Lilly's dead. (He looks up in shock.)"
She what?!'
She's dead."
Are you sure?'
Well, if she isn't then cremating her was a big mistake."
I can't believe this. I just\xc2\x97I can't believe this.\nHow-how\xc2\x97Oh my God. How long ago?"
17 years ago.'
Oh! What about, what about the girls?'
Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho. And Phoebe,\n(pause) is on this couch.'
Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you!'

Phoebe, I-I-I-umm, (Sits down next to her and brushes against her\nleg.) Oops. (He backs up.) I just, I-I-I-I don\xc2\x92t, I don\xc2\x92t know what to say. I\njust can't believe that you're my daughter, you're so pretty."
Yes. Well, that's neither here nor there."
So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very\nsorry that I left?'
Y'know what, it doesn\xc2\x92t matter what you say it's not gonna make a\ndifference anyway, so you can just go."
All right. Well, y'know in my defense I was a lousy father."
That's a defense?"
Yes. Yes it is. I burned the formula and I put your diapers on\nbackwards. I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more!'
You make up songs?'
Well no, just-just that one. But, it was stupid. Let's see, how did\nit, how did it go. Umm. (Singing.) "
I just, I y'know, I'm not very good at this. So, umm\xc2\x85 (Backs\naway.)"
Well, I am. (Moves over and takes his hand.)'
Not yet, no. (Drops his hand and moves back.)'
(dejected) Hi.'
Hey!'
Hey man, how did the audition go?'
Estelle said I didn't get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)"
What?! Why? Joey you were so ready for it!'
Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems\nwith me.'
What kind of problem?'
Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the\nbag!'
Oh my God!'
Nooooo!'
Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!"
Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag."
I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach?\n(She's avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!"
Honey wait, Joey, I\xc2\x92m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are\nwith it\xc2\x85 (Looks for help.)'
Oh, hey! (Ross nods in agreement as well.)'
\xc2\x85I just don't know if the world is ready for you and your bag."
I can't believe I'm hearing this!"
Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I'm not saying that you shouldn\xc2\x92t\nhave a bag, I just\xc2\x97it's just there are other bags that are a little less umm, (Pause)\ncontroversial."
Yeah umm, they're called wallets."
